result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco E Morra

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Marco E Morra in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Marco E Morra.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing after 11/18/2022. State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

2:50 PM Defendant Marco E Morra in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Mark Maier. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
